page.title: 05The Sewage Works, Hailsham
page.content: Hailsham is growing & to accommodate the extra housing the sewage works, originally commissioned in 1974, has since been nearly rebuilt by frequent updating. Sewage is treated by the activated sludge process. It also serves Hellingly & The Dickers as well as Hailsham with a total population of 14,000. Southern Water Authority are ultimately responsible to the Dept. of Environment. Farm Houses are on main drainage. There are 2 sewerage systems flowing through the area. One is via embanked waterways - dykes - called Harebeating Stream & Hurst Haven which carry surface water drainage & treated effluent. Average pump drain level is 1.7m. The other is the dirty water sewerage carried to a treatment plant. Average pump drain level is 0.6m. These waterways, after treatment, are carried to Pevensey Levels.
